doc.after: Hinduism has no central doctrinal authority and many practising Hindus do not claim to belong to any particular denomination 213 However four major denominations are recognised Vaishnavism Shaivism Shaktism and Smartism web 16 The denominations differ primarily in the god worshipped as the Supreme One and in the traditions that accompany worship of that deity
